title: Crystal Palace inquire into signing Ipswich 'keeper Bartosz Bialkowski
description: Crystal Palace have inquired into signing Ipswich goalkeeper Bartosz Bialkowski, Sky Sports News understands.
content: There has been contact between the two clubs within the past few weeks regarding the 30-year-old Pole.The Eagles have made signing a new 'keeper a priority in the January transfer window and Bialkowski is one of a number of players they are considering.Sky Sports News reported in the summer that Palace were interested in Tottenham's number two Michel Vorm.Bialkowski established himself as Ipswich's first choice during the 2016-17 season, in which the former Poland U21 made 44 appearances.He has started all 24 of Ipswich's Championship games this term, with the club currently sitting in 10th.Bialkowski first moved to England in 2006 when he joined Southampton but he struggled for first-team games and eventually joined Notts County in 2012 after a brief spell on loan at Barnsley.
